snippet: Mark Spangler, an investment adviser, preached the doctrine of acting in his clients’ best interest. But his actions put the lie to his beliefs.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column offers cautionary tale about Mark Spangler, once-respected investment adviser who is now awaiting what could be a life sentence on charges of fraud, money-laundering and investment adviser fraud for instigating Ponzi scheme; notes that Spangler had preached the doctrine of acting in his clients' best interest, but his actions proved otherwise.
lead_paragraph: Mark Spangler, an investment adviser, preached the doctrine of acting in his clients’ best interest. But his actions put the lie to his beliefs.

headline.print_headline: The Cautionary Tale of an Investment Adviser Gone Astray
